pull_request.title: implement screw joint in simbody and clean up screw joint constraint in ode

pullrequest.title: implement screw joint in simbody and clean up screw joint constraint in ode

content.raw: bullet angular joints are limited to less than (-π,+π), so screw joints with high thread pitch ratio (rad/m) like the pr2 gripper here cannot travel much in the linear direction.  But at least things are stable for now.
content.html: bullet angular joints are limited to less than (-π,+π), so screw joints with high thread pitch ratio (rad/m) like the pr2 gripper here cannot travel much in the linear direction. But at least things are stable for now.

pull_request.title: implement screw joint in simbody and clean up screw joint constraint in ode

pullrequest.title: implement screw joint in simbody and clean up screw joint constraint in ode

content.raw: 619ffde uncommented constraint error correction, so screw joints don't drift so much that axis becomes misaligned and unrealistic torque is injected into the system; thus preventing weird PR2 gripper behavior.
content.html: 619ffde uncommented constraint error correction, so screw joints don't drift so much that axis becomes misaligned and unrealistic torque is injected into the system; thus preventing weird PR2 gripper behavior.

content.raw:
I must protest that including significant refactoring in a pull request that was already substantial makes it much less reviewable (I'm referring to [GS]etAttribute -> [GS]etParam and changing return type of [GS]et{Low|High}Stop).

In my mind, this should be 2 or 3 pull requests. Yes, the tests are currently passing, but I can't approve in good conscience something of this complexity.

I can help to split this into smaller pull requests.
content.html:
I must protest that including significant refactoring in a pull request that was already substantial makes it much less reviewable (I'm referring to [GS]etAttribute -> [GS]etParam and changing return type of [GS]et{Low|High}Stop).

In my mind, this should be 2 or 3 pull requests. Yes, the tests are currently passing, but I can't approve in good conscience something of this complexity.

I can help to split this into smaller pull requests.
